channel.title: Latest alerts from washingtonpost.com
channel.description: An unofficial feed created by Derek Willis.

item.title: EPA plans to weaken rule curbing 'forever chemicals' in drinking water
item.description: The Environmental Protection Agency plans to rescind and reconsider limits on four different “forever chemicals” under a landmark drinking water standard implemented last year by President Joe Biden, according to documents reviewed by The Washington Post. The limits were adopted as part of the Biden administration’s efforts to limit public exposure to per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS), hazardous chemicals linked to a range of serious illnesses.

item.title: Pete Buttigieg, eyeing a presidential run, says ‘maybe’ Biden hurt Democrats
item.description: The former Biden administration official spent Tuesday in Iowa, where he suggested he would look at running in 2028. In his highest-profile public appearance since leaving government, Buttigieg also warned not to “hang back” against President Donald Trump.

item.title: Menendez brothers resentenced to 50 years to life with immediate parole eligibility
item.description: A state parole board will consider whether to recommend that Erik and Lyle Menendez be released.

item.title: Cassie Ventura recounted coercive ‘freak-offs’ with escorts, and other key moments from Day 2 of the Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs trial
item.description: Ventura testified that Combs coerced her into participating in days-long drug- and sex-fueled parties with male escorts, which Combs allegedly filmed and directed down to the smallest details.

item.title: MLB reinstates Pete Rose, ‘Shoeless’ Joe Jackson and other deceased players, making them eligible for Hall of Fame
item.description: Commissioner Rob Manfred ruled that MLB’s punishment of banned individuals ends with their deaths. The decision comes months after President Donald Trump said he would issue a “complete pardon” to Rose, who died last year at 83.

item.title: The big changes in Trump and Republicans’ giant tax and immigration bill, from Medicaid cuts to taxes on college endowments
item.description: Hearings are underway in House committees as the GOP tries to move ahead with legislation to extend tax cuts, reshape the economy and fund the White House’s immigration crackdown.

item.title: Trump announces U.S. will remove all sanctions against Syria to give the country ‘a chance at a greatness’
item.description: President Donald Trump’s remarks, delivered from Saudi Arabia, garnered a standing ovation from Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and others. “Oh, what I do for the crown prince,” Trump mused after some of the applause had died down.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Career-dazed college student wonders how people choose their jobs
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Career-dazed college student wonders how people choose their jobs

item.title: What these Pennsylvania factory workers are saying about Trump’s tariffs
item.description: Business is flourishing at this furniture maker, but even here workers want certainty — and lower prices.

item.title: Star witness Cassie Ventura testifies that arguments with Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs often ended in physical abuse. Follow our coverage.
item.description: Ventura has alleged years of abuse and sexual exploitation during her relationship with Combs, who faces 15 years to life in prison if convicted on all counts.

item.title: Giving away money in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Tuesday points.

item.title: Inflation rose in April compared to March but the annual pace eased, in a first test of Trump’s economic policies
item.description: The consumer price index rose at an annual rate of 2.3 percent for April, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Inflation has eased in recent years but remains above the Federal Reserve's goal of 2 percent.

item.title: Qatar's gift of luxury jet to Trump would be a security problem, experts say
item.description: The luxury jet was moved five weeks ago to San Antonio International Airport, suggesting that preparations for improvements to the plane might already be underway.

item.title: Trump’s Middle East trip. Trade war. White South Africans. Hostage release. Diddy trial. Humidity. Biological age. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: French film star Gérard Depardieu found guilty in sexual assault case
item.description: The 76-year-old actor was convicted of groping two women during the filming of “Les Volets Verts” (“The Green Shutters”) in 2021 in a landmark moment for France’s #MeToo movement. Depardieu had rejected the accusations during the four-day trial.

item.title: Mavericks win NBA draft lottery, earning right to select top prospect Cooper Flagg with No. 1 pick next month
item.description: Dallas won the lottery drawing in Chicago on Monday night, and it is widely expected to draft Flagg, the 18-year-old Duke product who has long been considered the best draft-eligible player available this year. The draft is June 25 and 26 in New York.

item.title: The hidden ways Trump and DOGE are shutting down parts of the federal government
item.description: Limits on spending have incapacitated parts of agencies as varied as the National Park Service and the Pentagon, according to interviews with federal employees and records reviewed by The Washington Post. At the Environmental Protection Agency, according to three employees, research at 11 laboratories has ground to a halt because of a requirement that Trump officials must approve all new lab purchases.

item.title: U.S.-China tariff reprieve powers Wall Street, lifting the S&P 500 more than 3 percent higher
item.description: Markets are “uttering a huge sigh of relief” after the two nations agreed to lower most tariffs for 90 days and signaled plans for continuing talks.

item.title: The hidden engine behind American innovation is being destroyed. We might not notice until it’s gone.
item.description: Why destroy the funding that made the U.S. a leader in technology and invention?

item.title: White South Africans arrive in U.S. to resettle across 10 states as refugees, a status Trump has suspended for all other groups
item.description: The order allowing Afrikaners to enter the United States on allegations of racial discrimination restarts a refugee resettlement program that has seen most funding halted in recent months. They landed at Dulles International Airport and will board connecting flights to be resettled in various states, according to three government officials.

item.title: Hamas releases last living U.S. hostage Edan Alexander from captivity in Gaza
item.description: The 21-year-old dual national was abducted while serving in the Israeli military on Oct. 7, 2023. Hamas said it was releasing Alexander as a step toward a lasting ceasefire with Israel, following talks with the Trump administration.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: How to shut down an in-law who thinks her meanness is funny?
item.description: Carolyn Hax: How to shut down an in-law who thinks her meanness is funny?

item.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs beat singer Cassie ‘brutally,’ prosecutors say in trial’s opening statements. Follow our coverage.
item.description: Here’s what the prosecution and defense teams have to say as the embattled music mogul’s federal trial kicks into gear in New York. Assistant U.S. Attorney Emily Johnson has focused on R&B singer Cassie Ventura throughout the first part of her opening statement.

item.title: Stocks surge on U.S.-China tariffs deal, with S&P 500 opening nearly 3 percent higher
item.description: Markets rallied after the United States and China agreed to dramatically lower most tariffs for 90 days, offering a temporary reprieve in the trade war.

item.title: No ‘sitting in his kingdom’ in today’s On the Record
item.description: No ‘sitting in his kingdom’ in today’s On the Record

item.title: Air Force One. China tariffs. Trump and Putin. Hostage release. Pope Leo. Pap smear. Lullabies. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: U.S., China agree to suspend most tariffs for 90 days as trade negotiations continue
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods would be reduced from 145 to 30 percent. China said it would cut its blanket tariffs from 125 to 10 percent starting Wednesday. The agreement provides a temporary reprieve in a trade war that threatens to cause a global recession and deepen a widening rift between the world’s two largest economies.

item.title: One of the last U.S. pencil factories is divided over Trump’s tariffs: ‘We are not too sure about making America great this way’
item.description: At Musgrave Pencil Company in Shelbyville, Tennessee, politics rarely came up before this year. President Donald Trump’s policies have changed that.

item.title: Anti-vaccine uproar over Trump's new surgeon general pick exposes MAHA divisions
item.description: The nominee, Casey Means, a nutrition advocate and ally of Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., faces criticism for not opposing vaccines enough. The division highlights a tension between prioritizing food or vaccination in the Make America Healthy Again movement.

item.title: Qatar is discussing donating an aircraft to the U.S. government for Trump to use, two people familiar with the matter say
item.description: While the deal is not final, ethics experts are raising concerns about the possible donation from a foreign government, which they say is unconstitutional.

item.title: Still need to finish this weekend’s On the Record? We’ve got you.
item.description: Play now to finish out your score for the week.

item.title: Federal judges are receiving unsolicited pizza deliveries they say are meant to intimidate them
item.description: Many of the deliveries, judges say, have gone to those presiding over lawsuits challenging the Trump administration’s policies. Deliveries began in February and may number in the hundreds across at least seven states, prompting increased security concerns and a demand for a Justice Department investigation.

item.title: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now
item.description: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now

item.title: Mayor Bowser’s approval rating recovers as Trump worries emerge, poll finds
item.description: D.C. Mayor Muriel E. Bowser’s approval rating has rebounded from last year’s decade-low marks, a Washington Post-Schar School poll finds, as residents’ concerns about crime decline — and worries about President Donald Trump and a GOP-controlled Congress’s incursions on the city’s autonomy emerge.

item.title: Land is sinking under America’s largest cities. See whether yours is affected.
item.description: The 28 most populous U.S. cities are sinking to some degree, threatening buildings, roads and rail lines, according to a new study.

item.title: ‘Buzzkill.’ ‘Frustrated.’ Five small-business leaders explain what Trump’s tariffs really mean for you.
item.description: Makers of clothes, beer and more on what tariffs really mean for you

item.title: Korea’s aging extreme divers could hold the key to treating chronic disease
item.description: For generations, Jeju Island women have been diving to gather food from depths of up to 60 feet using only the bodies that genes and conditioning have given them. Now, an international team of researchers has found evidence of natural selection at work.

item.title: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.
item.description: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.

item.title: Trump announces ‘immediate’ India-Pakistan ceasefire after four nights of escalating violence between the nuclear-armed neighbors
item.description: President Donald Trump said in a post online that an agreement was reached “after a long night of talks mediated by the United States.” The ceasefire was confirmed by Pakistan’s foreign minister and by Indian officials.

item.title: Pakistan says it has struck military targets inside India, bringing the nuclear-armed rivals nearer to war
item.description: Pakistan said early Saturday it had hit several Indian military sites, days after India launched its largest strikes inside Pakistan in decades.

item.title: Congress should raise debt limit by July to avoid default while lawmakers are away in August, Bessent says
item.description: The warning from the treasury secretary gives Republicans a clear deadline for passing President Donald Trump's budget and tax bill.

item.title: About 60 White South Africans expected to arrive at Dulles Airport next week as refugees under Trump executive order
item.description: The Afrikaners are expected to arrive on a State Department-chartered plane Monday, with federal and Virginia officials preparing to receive them in a ceremonial news conference, according to documents and emails obtained by The Washington Post, as well as three government officials familiar with the preparations.

item.title: Carolyn Hax chat: My cheating ex wants to be involved in my pregnancy
item.description: Carolyn Hax chat: My cheating ex wants to be involved in my pregnancy

item.title: D.C.-area economy appears headed toward economic slump, experts warn
item.description: Rising unemployment and a drop in spending are among several signs of a downturn in the region on par with the one that occurred during the pandemic.

item.title: Neo-monarchist blogger Curtis Yarvin helped inspire DOGE. Now he scorns it.
item.description: Silicon Valley's pro-authoritarian muse has influenced the likes of JD Vance and Peter Thiel. But he has come to think that Elon Musk's bureaucracy slashers have lost their way.

item.title: 10 questions, plus a bonus wager! It’s the weekend edition of On the Record.
item.description: Think you’ve got what it takes to earn a perfect score? Take today’s longer news quiz and complete your point total for the week.

item.title: Former Supreme Court justice David Souter dies at 85. He favored judicial restraint during his time on the court.
item.description: On the high court from 1990 to 2009, he saw his role as one of quiet resistance against excess and dramatic change. He supplied a key vote to uphold abortion rights in his early years on the court.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV. Trump taxes. Jeanine Pirro. India and Pakistan. El Salvador. Disaster tracker. Secret apartment. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Trump names Fox News host Jeanine Pirro to replace Ed Martin as interim D.C. U.S. attorney
item.description: Pirro served as a judge and district attorney in Westchester County, New York. She joined Fox News as a legal analyst in 2006 and currently is a co-host of the conservative-leaning talk show “The Five.” Pirro will replace Martin as interim U.S. attorney after GOP senators balked at his nomination.

item.title: Justice Department is investigating New York Attorney General Letitia James, who has targeted Trump
item.description: The probe of mortgage records for a home that James and her niece purchased in Norfolk, Virginia, is the first known criminal investigation by the Trump administration of a law enforcement official who has taken action against the president.
